summary: Jeremy Ray Akers is identified as an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). His name appears in multiple payroll and certification reports spanning from 1977 to 1978. These documents list his name, position, annual salary, and gross pay for specific accounting periods. The consistent appearance of his name across these documents indicates his employment with the HSCA during the period when the committee was actively investigating the JFK assassination.
significance: Jeremy Ray Akers' significance lies in his employment with the HSCA during its investigation into the JFK assassination. While the documents do not specify his role within the committee, his presence on payroll and certification reports confirms his involvement in the HSCA's operations during a critical period of investigation.
